data.title: Gourmet burgers reasonably priced
data.text: There's not much more you need to know other than these burgers are great and it won't break the bank. Bear in mind it's more expensive than fast food but less expensive than five guy's if that helps. This is connected to street craves which also has street tacos and other pub-ish eats. There is also a full bar and outdoor seating which is great in good weather. TVs all over every wall and a great place to watch the game.

data.title: The Name Says it All
data.text:
If you have a name like "Freakin' Unbelievable" you better live up to it - and this place does. I have to agree with another reviewer that the fact that Freakin' Unbelievable and Street Craves are the same place is odd and confusing, but it is what it is. The front of the restaurant says Street Craves, and the back entrance says Freakin' Unbelievable. Parking is difficult - there is a $5 cash lot behind the restaurant or street parking if you're lucky enough to find something. 
All that aside - the food is definitely worth the hassle. I had the Ancho BBQ burger and sweet potato fries. The ancho bbq sauce was a great pairing with angus beef, cheese, and bacon. The buns were light and fluffy and added the right mix of flavor and texture to the burger. The sweet potato fries were sprinkled with cinnamon sugar bringing in a whole new flavor profile to the meal. It all worked in the most unexpected way! Pair that with a cold beer or soda and you have yourself a meal. 
If parking wasn't such an issue, I would make this a regular spot to visit while in Lexington.
Be sure to take the time to try this restaurant out. You won't be disappointed in the food.

data.title: One of the best burgers I have had!
data.text: Today was my first visit.  I went with me son and a co-worker.  We all got burgers and were all impressed.  I got onion straws with mine and the others got fries.  Both were good.  I will definitely be going back

data.title: Kind of odd first impression
data.text: Our party of six went last week and had trouble finding it because we didn't realize it is also street craves. (We are new here and came on college move in day) After stumbling in through the back door we had to figure out which menu to use and order at the front. The cashier was helpful but the person who delivered our burgers was very unprofessional.  He came out and started handing out random burgers, without saying what they were. And when we asked what each one was so we could differentiate our orders, he didn't seem to really know what to do besides give us what was on the tray and go. So when one order was wrong and we had a missing small fry, one of us had to go back to the counter to fix it.  The server failed to mention that at least the miss fries were being brought out by another server, who came a few minutes later while our group member was still waiting in line about the wrong burger and fries. The food was good when we got it, but not the best first impression.

data.title: Great Lunch, twice
data.text:
I met a friend here a couple of weeks ago. We both ordered the pick two lunch special, where you get a half salad and two tacos. We're both big guys, and we were satisfied. You can pick any salad and any two tacos. I got a southwestern salad--spicy and good with chicken, and Korean tacos. All was very good, priced under $10. 

Parking can be tricky; street parking available on Limestone and behind.

data.title: Street Craves better than Burgers
data.text: The burgers are mediocre at best, but we really like the Street Craves menu. Pet friendly in the outside dining area is a plus for us.  Server even brought water out for our puppy.

data.title: Great place for a burger and a beer!
data.text: The burgers here really are excellent, and the fried pickles are AWESOME! I love that you can also get great salads or tacos, and a full bar as well.  The place is clean, and the outdoor patio area is very inviting.

data.title: Frickin awesome burgers!
data.text:
My husband found this place on Yelp, we were a little bit hungover & were craving some seriously good burgers.

I ordered the southwest burger & it was delish, I had mine with sweet potato fries, which were some of the best I've had. I love a brioche bun so this burger was a winner for me.

My husband ordered the fire burger and he thoroughly enjoyed it, he had regular fries, which were awesome but as soon as he tried one of my sweet potato ones he wish he'd ordered them.

I would absolutely eat here again, I just wish I'd ordered a shake now, Oh well next time.

data.title: Nice Outdoor Seating
data.text: Enjoyed ourselves on the patio.  Burgers all very good, beers were fresh from clean lines.  You will stand in line to order food, and have to go to the bar to get anything with alcohol in it.

data.title: Unbelievable is right
data.text:
My husband took me here and I was not too happy about going. The prices are kind of high for a lunch outing for us. However, when I got my Burger, I was blown away. It was so good I couldn't believe it. I not only enjoyed it, I cant wait to go back for another. 

I had a single with Bacon, eggs, and American cheese, mayo, lettuce and sweet potato fries (which were also amazing)

data.title: Not quite what I expected
data.text: I wasnt sure what to expect from a burger/street taco/bar, but it wasn't this. The atmosphere is nice, the decor gives it a nicer than casual feel. However, the menu and fountain drink machine do not. The staff was very friendly. I got a burger, which was decent, and fries that were exceptionally delicious. It took a little longer than I'd expected based on how many people were there, but the wait wasn't outrageous. The owner came up and asked about my meal, which was nice. Overall I'd say it is little pricey, especially the drinks from the bar, but still worth a try.

data.title: Really freakin good!
data.text:
Wow! Great place with friendly helpful staff. Food was delicious and served hot! We had turkey burger and sweet potato fries, yummy!
You need to eat here!!!!

data.title: Worth a freakin try
data.text: Stopped in on a Monday night, not busy.  New, modern decor, and clean inside.  Training a new server so they were a bit slow to get to us but afterwards were very attentive.  Manager checked in partway through.  Burger was above average, double, with special Big Mac like sauce.  Creative menu though "freakin" is used excessively.  Fries were simple, cheese sticks were tasty.  Took a salmon burger to go.  Would eat there again.

data.title: Freakin terrible service
data.text: Went there for a good meal and our drink order was prompt, placed our food order and waited over an hour. Then our waitress informed us that our order was lost. We ended up leaving but discovered a great restaurant within walking distance to them. Will never go back until they get their service gets up to standards.

data.title: New  and so not worth it
data.text:
I typically never issue a negative or harsh reviews, but I have to give my honest opinion- and it is only MY opinion. This place sucks..plain and simple it sucks.
This joint replaced HUGH JASS Burgers on the corner of S. Limestone and Avenue of Champions near the University of Kentucky campus. Here is the break down: Front side of the joint serves up something they call "street taco's" (which in Kentucky could be an eyebrow raiser) if you want a burger they prefer you go the back of the place off of Jersey Street. You "can" order either or but they stressed it more than once that burgers were in the back..I don't know why but I found that kind of ridiculous. You may sit wherever you like, so what the  blankety blank does it matter where specifically I place my order? The menu is not all that different than any other novelty burger place, rather taco, rather..ahh whatever. The items are pricey, and the service was super slow. The food was crap. The fries were too hot, too hot, and way too crunchy. The burger was damn near 9 bucks, and I could have gotten a better burger at a Frisch's  Big Boy! I spent 22 minutes of my thirty minute lunch waiting on my food and could not have been more disappointed honestly. I truly hate to be so negative, but this place is not worth wasting your money. It was awful, and I will never again go back. RIP OFF!!!!! Just keep walking past this money trap.

data.title: 信じられない
data.text: 一見するとハンバーガーショップとは思えないオシャレな店舗。 店内もシルバーで統一されたクールな雰囲気でした。 ハンバーガーは、ふつうの物の他に　チキンステーキや　コロッケのバーガーなど数種類。ソースや トッピングの野菜などを選ぶスタイルでした。チキンステーキに人参のペーストをあわせた　バーガーが　おいしかったです。
